game.plot: Vampire Savior - The Lord of Vampire (c) 1997 Capcom Company, Limited.[CR]Fifteen characters fight to end the reign of Jedah, the Vampire Savior and save their own souls![CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the "CP System II" hardware.[CR]Green Board [Japan][CR]Players: Up to 2[CR]Control: 8-way joystick per player.[CR]Buttons: 6 per player.[CR]= > [1] LP, [2] MP, [3] HP[CR]= > [4] LK, [5] MK, [6] HK[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]Vampire Savior was released in May 1997 in the Japanese arcades. It was known there as the 22th video game released for the CPS2 hardware.[CR]Known export releases:[CR]"Vampire Savior - The Lord of Vampire [Blue Board]"[CR]"Vampire Savior - The Lord of Vampire [Grey Board]"[CR]"Vampire Savior - The Lord of Vampire [Orange Board]"[CR]Secret Title: Darkstalkers - Jedah's Damnation (hosted in a gfx rom but not used in the game). Some Blue Board copies were hacked to use the 'Jedah's Damnation' title.[CR]Lilith was originally slightly different, in back-story, to the one we know now. She was what is occasionally referred to as a white-wing, with her angelic heritage hidden from view most of the time. This idea was dropped, due to, supposedly, too many angel characters in games. Briefly, She was redesigned as a hermaphrodite, but that too was dropped, most likely due to the fact it would have courted controversy, and instead she was made into part of Morrigan.[CR]Victor Entertainment released a limited-edition soundtrack album for this game (Vampire Savior : Capcom Game Soundtrack - VICL-60098, 60099) on August 21, 1997.[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]* Hidden Warriors : to reach your character's hidden warrior, you must finish the stage without losing any energy bats, and without timeouts. The KO move MUST be an EX Finish. Dark Force or ES Finishes may be acceptable, but an EX Finish is preferred. If you meet this condition, you'll get a 'Here comes a new challenger' prompt as you enter the fourth stage. Each character has their own boss character fights (i.e. Demitri's final boss is Morrigan, Jedah's final boss is Demitri, etc.), and after you finish the first 6 stages, you must defeat your character's boss character in Stage 7 to finish the game. If your character's final boss is Jedah, there will be a special intro scene. [CR]* Play as Original Jon Talbain ('Gallon' in Japan) : at the character select screen, highlight Jon Talbain ('Gallon') and press Start and all three punch buttons at the same time. [CR]* Shoul Mode : on the character select screen, go to the [?] box, press Start 5 times, then push any punch or kick button. [CR]* Alternate Shoul Mode : on the character select screen, go to the character whom you would like to use first stage, press Start 3 times, after go to the [?] box, press Start 5 times, then push any punch or kick button. [CR]* Win Poses : by holding any attack button at the end of a fight, you may choose most of each character's win poses. However, there are a few that can't be seen with this trick, such as Felicia's perfect win pose. [CR]* Tricks : even though the Start button is mostly used as a taunt button, there are a few characters that can use it for some rather silly moves such as Sasquatch & Felicia. [CR]If you leap at the enemy's head without attacking while using Felicia, you'll sit on their heads as long as neither player moves at all. An extra taunt? :) [CR]* EX MOVES : [CR]Anakaris : [CR]1) (3/4 max) In the Sarcophage : Left, DownLeft, Down, DownRight, Right + 2 Punches [CR]2) (1/2 max) Pharao Magic I : MK, LP, Down, LK, MP [CR]3) [Need 2 powers] (1/2 max) Pharao Magic II : HK, MP, Down, MK, HP [CR]4) [Need 3 powers] (1/2 max) Pharao Magic III : HK, MP, LK, Down, LP, MK, HP [CR]B. B. Hood ('Bulleta' in Japan) : [CR]1) (Anywhere) Hunt the Duck : Left, DownLeft, Down, DownRight, Right + 2 Punches [CR]2) (Near) Beautiful Memory : Left, DownLeft, Down, DownRight, Right + 2 Kicks [CR]3) (Close) Apple Blast : Right, DownRight, Down, DownLeft, Left + 2 Kicks [CR]Bishamon : [CR]1) (Close) Oni Kubi Hineri : Right, DownRight, Down, DownLeft, Left + 2 Punches [CR]2) (Anywhere) Enma Seki : Left, DownLeft, Down, DownRight + 2 Kicks [CR]Demitri : [CR]1) (3/4 max) Demon Pillion : Down, Right, DownRight + 2 Kicks [CR]2) (Sweep distance) Sucking the Blood : Right, Down, DownRight + 2 Punches [CR]3) [Need 2 powers] (Sweep Distance) Midnight Pleasure : LP, MP, Right, MK, MK [CR]Felicia : [CR]1) (3/4 max) Weapon X - 11 hit : Left, DownLeft, Down, DownRight, Right + 2 Punches [CR]2) (Anywhere) Help Me, Please - 34 hit : Left, DownLeft, Down, DownRight, Right + 2 Kicks [CR]Hsein Ko ('Lei Lei' in Japan) : [CR]1) (Anywhere) The Blast : Left, DownLeft, Down, DownRight, Right + 2 Punches [CR]2) (Anywhere) Chireitou : Left, DownLeft, Down, DownRight, Right + 2 Kicks [CR]3) (Anywhere) Tenraiha : LK, HK, MP, MP, Up [CR]Jedah : [CR]1) (Anywhere) Finale Rosso : Down (x2) + 2 Punches [CR]2) (Anywhere) Plova Di Selbo : Left, DownLeft, Down, DownRight, Right + 2 Kicks, Tap MK to grap opponent [CR]Jon Talbain ('Gallon' in Japan) : [CR]1) (Anywhere) Dragon Cannon : Left, DownLeft, Down, DownRight, Right + 2 Kicks [CR]2) (Close) Moment Slice : LP, MP, Right, LK, MK [CR]Lilith : [CR]1) (near) Bats : Right, Down, DownRight + 2 Kicks [CR]2) (near) Luminous Vision : LP, LP, Right, LK, HP [CR]3) [Need 2 powers] (Far) Gloomy Puppet Show : Down, DownRight, Right + 2 Kicks [CR]Lord Raptor ('Zabel Zarock' in Japan) : [CR]1) (1/2 max) Evil Scream : Right, Left + 2 Punches [CR]2) (1/2 max) Death Voltage : Right, DownRight, Down, DownLeft + 2 Kicks [CR]3) (Anywhere) Hell Dunk : Right, Down, DownRight + 2 Punches [CR]Q-Bee : [CR]1) (3/4 max) Chrysalid : Right, Down, DownRight + 2 Punches [CR]2) (Anywhere) Bee attack : Left, DownLeft, Down, DownRight, Right + 2 Kicks [CR]Morrigan : [CR]1) (Sweep Distance) Darkness Illusion : LP, LP, Right, LK, HP [CR]2) (Anywhere) Valkyrie Turn : Right, RightDown, Down, DownLeft, Left, (any) Kick, then LK (close), or MK (medium), or HK (far) [CR]3) (Anywhere) Shocked : Right, HP, MP, LP, Right [CR]4) (Anywhere) Finishing Shower : MP, LP, Left, LK, MK [CR]Rikuo ('Aulbath' in Japan) : [CR]1) (1/2 max) Aqua Spread : Right, DownRight, Down + 2 Kicks or 2 Punches [CR]2) (Anywhere) Water Jail : Right, Down, DownRight + 2 Punches [CR]3) (Anywhere) Sea Rage - 8 hit : Left, DownLeft, Down, DownRight, Right + 2 Punches [CR]4) [Need 3 powers] (Close) Direct Scissors : Down(x2) + 2 Punches [CR]Sasquatch : [CR]1) (Anywhere) Big Freezer : Left, DownLeft, Down, DownRight + 2 Punches [CR]2) (3/4 screen max) Big Eisbahn : Left, DownLeft, Down, DownRight + 2 Kicks [CR]3) (Close) Big Sledge : 720 degrees + 2 Kicks [CR]Victor : [CR]1) (Anywhere) Thunder Break : Down (2s), Up + 2 Kicks [CR]2) (Corps to corps) MEGA Gerdenheim : 720 degrees + 2 Kicks[CR][B]Game Series[/B][CR]1. game.name: X-Men: Children of the Atom (Japan 950105)
game.plot: X-Men - Children of the Atom (c) 1994 Capcom Company, Limited.[CR]Back when Magneto and Juggernaut were boss characters, ten X-Men characters fought to challenge them![CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the "CP System II" hardware.[CR]Green Board [Japan][CR]Players: Up to 2.[CR]Control: 8-way joystick per player.[CR]Buttons: 6 per player.[CR]=> [1] LP (Jab), [2] MP (Short), [3] HP (Fierce)[CR]=> [4] LK (Strong), [5] MK (Forward), [6] HK (Roundhouse)[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]X-Men COTA was released in December 1994 in the Japanese arcades. It was known there as the 8th video game released for the CPS2 hardware.[CR]Known export releases:[CR]"X-Men - Children of the Atom [Blue Board]"[CR]"X-Men - Children of the Atom [Grey Board]"[CR]"X-Men - Children of the Atom [Orange Board]"[CR]A special 'Rent' version is known to exists as "X-Men - Children of the Atom [Yellow Board]".[CR]It is the first fighting game produced by Capcom using characters under license from Marvel Comics, widely praised for its faithfulness in capturing the spirit of its namesake comics, by using colorful animation and voice actors (see Staff section for more information) from the 'X-Men' animated series.[CR]All characters are coming from Marvel comic books (except Akuma) :[CR]Akuma ('Gouki' in Japan) - "Super Street Fighter II Turbo" (Super Street Fighter II X - Grand Master Challenge" in Japan)[CR]Colossus (aka Piotr Nikolaievitch Rasputin) - Giant-Size X-Men #1[CR]Cyclops (aka Scott Summers) - X-Men #1[CR]Juggernaut (aka Cain Marko) - X-Men #12[CR]Iceman (aka Robert 'Bobby' Drake) - Uncanny X-Men #1[CR]Magneto (aka Erik 'Magnus' Lehnsherr) - X-Men #1[CR]Omega Red (aka Arkady Rossovich) - X-Men #4[CR]Psylocke (aka Elizabeth 'Betsy' Braddock) - New Mutants Annual #2[CR]Sentinel - Uncanny X-Men #14[CR]Silver Samurai (aka Kenichiro Harada) - Daredevil #111[CR]Spiral (aka Rita Ricochet) - Longshot #1[CR]Storm (aka Ororo Munroe) - Giant Size X-Men #1[CR]Wolverine (aka James 'Logan' Howlett) - Incredible Hulk #180[CR]Unlike previous incarnations of X-Men video games, X-Men - Children of the Atom also allowed players to helm popular X-Men villains, such as Omega Red; the mutant hunting android Sentinel; Spiral, lackey of Mojo; and Silver Samurai. Also, because this game was released around the same time as "Super Street Fighter II Turbo", programmers also included Akuma (see Tips And Tricks section for more information).[CR]The game, along with SSFII Turbo, is considered as one of the first fighting games to popularize the now often-used ideas of 'Super Jumps', 'Super Combos', and 'Tech. Hit', which meant that an attempted grab or throw had been negated by the opponent. Furthermore, the game was the precursor to the Capcom 'Vs. series', with elements and characters from this game having been combined with "Street Fighter Alpha - Warriors' Dreams" to create "X-Men vs. Street Fighter".[CR]Sony Records released a limited-edition soundtrack album (X-Men Arcade Game Track - SRCL-3120) on March 24, 1995.[CR][B]Updates[/B][CR]Green Board revisions : [CR]REVISION 1 : [CR]* Software version : 1.00.[CR]* Build date : 941208[CR]REVISION 2 : [CR]* Software version : 2.00.[CR]* Build date : 941217[CR]REVISION 3 :[CR]* Software version : 2.10.[CR]* Build date : 941219 [CR]REVISION 4 : [CR]* Software version : 3.00[CR]* Build date : 950105[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]* Play as Akuma (Player 1) : Highlight Spiral and wait 3 seconds, then move without stopping through : Silver Samurai, Psylocke, Colossus, Iceman, Colossus, Cyclops, Wolverine, Omega Red and stop on Silver Samurai. Wait 3 seconds there and press and hold : LK+HP+HK.[CR]* Play as Akuma (Player 2) : Highlight Storm and wait 3 seconds, then move without stopping through : Cyclops, Colossus, Iceman, the Sentinel, Omega Red, Wolverine, Psylocke, Silver Samurai and stop on Spiral. Wait 3 seconds there, then press and hold : LK+HP+HK.[CR]* Play as Juggernaut (Player 1 and 2) : Input Akuma code, then after the battle press Up/Left TWICE and you should see Juggernaut's face.[CR]* Play against Akuma : You must use 'manual block' and win every match without continuing. Defeat your opponents two rounds in a row (don't lose a round), having 'first attack' on each round. You must also win the final round of each battle with your Hyper-X.[CR]* Continue Attacking : Press Start immediately after winning the match to continue hitting the defeated character.[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Game Planners : Akira Nishitani (Nin), Noritaka Funamizu (Poo), Hiratou K-Suke (X68K), Kiyo, Fuji, Tomita Otouto[CR]Programmers : Aoi-Tokimeki, Tarabar Hori (Tarabar - Black), K. Nishi-Man, Sailor-Ponkichi, O.G.T. -Iron Liver, Mo Suzuki-Memorial, Min-T3, Hard. Yas (-466P+K-), Kaw. Hiroshima[CR]Object Designers : Satoru Yamashita, Ino, Kuriotoko, Yue, Minobe Hiroaki (Minobe), M. Nakatani, Ari, Eripyon. N, Miwazo, M. Sato, Kamonchashi Sato, Kazuko Kawanaka Pyo!, Dway Nishimura, Igami, Youjiro, Sagat, Ta, Jun Matsumura (26), Hitoshi Nishio (Vip. T2), G. Kamina, Ushi, H. Yoshino, Eiji, Naoki Fukuda, H.S, Manish, Shinya Kitamura[CR]Scroll Designers : Fukumoyan, Yamapuu, May, Devil Ohnishi, Kazu, Akiko. O, Hiroko. N, Iwai, Kisabon, RK[CR]Music Composers : Takayuki Iwai (Anarchy Takapon), Syun Nishigaki, Hideki Okugawa (Hideki Ok), Isao Abe (Oyaji)[CR]Sound Designers : Hiroaki Kondo (X68K), Toshio Kajino[CR]* Voice Actors :[CR]Psylocke, Storm, Spiral : Catherine Disher[CR]Cyclops : Norman Spencer[CR]Wolverine : Cathal J. Dodd[CR]Beast : George Buza[CR]Colossus, Iceman, Sentinel : Dan Hennessey[CR]Silver Samurai : Yasushi Ikeda (Ike-Bomb)[CR]Omega Red : Len Doncheff[CR]Juggernaut : Rick Bennett[CR]Magneto : Lorne Kennedy[CR]Special Thanks : Alex Jimenez, Eric Luther, Phillip Reed, Mark Ericsson, Dana Morshed, Mike Thomas, John Conroy, Paul T. Takaki, Kumino Asakura, Takuya Shiraiwa (Mr. Shiraiwa)[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles : [CR]Sega Saturn [JP] (November 22, 1995) "X-Men - Children of the Atom [Model T-1203G]"[CR]

Dodd[CR]Beast : George Buza[CR]Colossus, Iceman, Sentinel : Dan Hennessey[CR]Silver Samurai : Yasushi Ikeda (Ike-Bomb)[CR]Omega Red : Len Doncheff[CR]Juggernaut : Rick Bennett[CR]Magneto : Lorne Kennedy[CR]Special Thanks : Alex Jimenez, Eric Luther, Phillip Reed, Mark Ericsson, Dana Morshed, Mike Thomas, John Conroy, Paul T. Takaki, Kumino Asakura, Takuya Shiraiwa (Mr. Shiraiwa)[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles : [CR]Sega Saturn [JP] (November 22, 1995) "X-Men - Children of the Atom [Model T-1203G]"[CR]

game.name: X-Men: Children of the Atom (Japan 941219)
game.plot: X-Men - Children of the Atom (c) 1994 Capcom Company, Limited.[CR]Back when Magneto and Juggernaut were boss characters, ten X-Men characters fought to challenge them![CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the "CP System II" hardware.[CR]Green Board [Japan][CR]Players: Up to 2.[CR]Control: 8-way joystick per player.[CR]Buttons: 6 per player.[CR]=> [1] LP (Jab), [2] MP (Short), [3] HP (Fierce)[CR]=> [4] LK (Strong), [5] MK (Forward), [6] HK (Roundhouse)[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]X-Men COTA was released in December 1994 in the Japanese arcades. It was known there as the 8th video game released for the CPS2 hardware.[CR]Known export releases:[CR]"X-Men - Children of the Atom [Blue Board]"[CR]"X-Men - Children of the Atom [Grey Board]"[CR]"X-Men - Children of the Atom [Orange Board]"[CR]A special 'Rent' version is known to exists as "X-Men - Children of the Atom [Yellow Board]".[CR]It is the first fighting game produced by Capcom using characters under license from Marvel Comics, widely praised for its faithfulness in capturing the spirit of its namesake comics, by using colorful animation and voice actors (see Staff section for more information) from the 'X-Men' animated series.[CR]All characters are coming from Marvel comic books (except Akuma) :[CR]Akuma ('Gouki' in Japan) - "Super Street Fighter II Turbo" (Super Street Fighter II X - Grand Master Challenge" in Japan)[CR]Colossus (aka Piotr Nikolaievitch Rasputin) - Giant-Size X-Men #1[CR]Cyclops (aka Scott Summers) - X-Men #1[CR]Juggernaut (aka Cain Marko) - X-Men #12[CR]Iceman (aka Robert 'Bobby' Drake) - Uncanny X-Men #1[CR]Magneto (aka Erik 'Magnus' Lehnsherr) - X-Men #1[CR]Omega Red (aka Arkady Rossovich) - X-Men #4[CR]Psylocke (aka Elizabeth 'Betsy' Braddock) - New Mutants Annual #2[CR]Sentinel - Uncanny X-Men #14[CR]Silver Samurai (aka Kenichiro Harada) - Daredevil #111[CR]Spiral (aka Rita Ricochet) - Longshot #1[CR]Storm (aka Ororo Munroe) - Giant Size X-Men #1[CR]Wolverine (aka James 'Logan' Howlett) - Incredible Hulk #180[CR]Unlike previous incarnations of X-Men video games, X-Men - Children of the Atom also allowed players to helm popular X-Men villains, such as Omega Red; the mutant hunting android Sentinel; Spiral, lackey of Mojo; and Silver Samurai. Also, because this game was released around the same time as "Super Street Fighter II Turbo", programmers also included Akuma (see Tips And Tricks section for more information).[CR]The game, along with SSFII Turbo, is considered as one of the first fighting games to popularize the now often-used ideas of 'Super Jumps', 'Super Combos', and 'Tech. Hit', which meant that an attempted grab or throw had been negated by the opponent. Furthermore, the game was the precursor to the Capcom 'Vs. series', with elements and characters from this game having been combined with "Street Fighter Alpha - Warriors' Dreams" to create "X-Men vs. Street Fighter".[CR]Sony Records released a limited-edition soundtrack album (X-Men Arcade Game Track - SRCL-3120) on March 24, 1995.[CR][B]Updates[/B][CR]Green Board revisions : [CR]REVISION 1 : [CR]* Software version : 1.00.[CR]* Build date : 941208[CR]REVISION 2 : [CR]* Software version : 2.00.[CR]* Build date : 941217[CR]REVISION 3 :[CR]* Software version : 2.10.[CR]* Build date : 941219 [CR]REVISION 4 : [CR]* Software version : 3.00[CR]* Build date : 950105[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]* Play as Akuma (Player 1) : Highlight Spiral and wait 3 seconds, then move without stopping through : Silver Samurai, Psylocke, Colossus, Iceman, Colossus, Cyclops, Wolverine, Omega Red and stop on Silver Samurai. Wait 3 seconds there and press and hold : LK+HP+HK.[CR]* Play as Akuma (Player 2) : Highlight Storm and wait 3 seconds, then move without stopping through : Cyclops, Colossus, Iceman, the Sentinel, Omega Red, Wolverine, Psylocke, Silver Samurai and stop on Spiral. Wait 3 seconds there, then press and hold : LK+HP+HK.[CR]* Play as Juggernaut (Player 1 and 2) : Input Akuma code, then after the battle press Up/Left TWICE and you should see Juggernaut's face.[CR]* Play against Akuma : You must use 'manual block' and win every match without continuing. Defeat your opponents two rounds in a row (don't lose a round), having 'first attack' on each round. You must also win the final round of each battle with your Hyper-X.[CR]* Continue Attacking : Press Start immediately after winning the match to continue hitting the defeated character.[CR][B]Staff[/B][CR]Game Planners : Akira Nishitani (Nin), Noritaka Funamizu (Poo), Hiratou K-Suke (X68K), Kiyo, Fuji, Tomita Otouto[CR]Programmers : Aoi-Tokimeki, Tarabar Hori (Tarabar - Black), K. Nishi-Man, Sailor-Ponkichi, O.G.T. -Iron Liver, Mo Suzuki-Memorial, Min-T3, Hard. Yas (-466P+K-), Kaw. Hiroshima[CR]Object Designers : Satoru Yamashita, Ino, Kuriotoko, Yue, Minobe Hiroaki (Minobe), M. Nakatani, Ari, Eripyon. N, Miwazo, M. Sato, Kamonchashi Sato, Kazuko Kawanaka Pyo!, Dway Nishimura, Igami, Youjiro, Sagat, Ta, Jun Matsumura (26), Hitoshi Nishio (Vip. T2), G. Kamina, Ushi, H. Yoshino, Eiji, Naoki Fukuda, H.S, Manish, Shinya Kitamura[CR]Scroll Designers : Fukumoyan, Yamapuu, May, Devil Ohnishi, Kazu, Akiko. O, Hiroko. N, Iwai, Kisabon, RK[CR]Music Composers : Takayuki Iwai (Anarchy Takapon), Syun Nishigaki, Hideki Okugawa (Hideki Ok), Isao Abe (Oyaji)[CR]Sound Designers : Hiroaki Kondo (X68K), Toshio Kajino[CR]* Voice Actors :[CR]Psylocke, Storm, Spiral : Catherine Disher[CR]Cyclops : Norman Spencer[CR]Wolverine : Cathal J. Dodd[CR]Beast : George Buza[CR]Colossus, Iceman, Sentinel : Dan Hennessey[CR]Silver Samurai : Yasushi Ikeda (Ike-Bomb)[CR]Omega Red : Len Doncheff[CR]Juggernaut : Rick Bennett[CR]Magneto : Lorne Kennedy[CR]Special Thanks : Alex Jimenez, Eric Luther, Phillip Reed, Mark Ericsson, Dana Morshed, Mike Thomas, John Conroy, Paul T. Takaki, Kumino Asakura, Takuya Shiraiwa (Mr. Shiraiwa)[CR][B]Game Ports[/B][CR]* Consoles : [CR]Sega Saturn [JP] (November 22, 1995) "X-Men - Children of the Atom [Model T-1203G]"[CR]

game.name: X-Men Vs. Street Fighter (Japan 961023)
game.plot: X-Men vs. Street Fighter (c) 1996 Capcom Company, Limited.[CR]The first 'Capcom vs.' fighter, featuring 16 classic characters and fast-paced tag action. The mighty Apocalypse is reduced to but a punching bag![CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the "CP System II" hardware.[CR]Green Board [Japan][CR]Players: Up to 2.[CR]Control: 8-way joystick per player.[CR]Buttons: 6 per player.[CR]= > [1] LP, [2] MP, [3] HP[CR]= > [4] LK, [5] MK, [6] HK[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]In August 1996, a prototype of the game was being tested at several arcades across the countries. One difference in this prototype is that Gambit has a different coat color, and his hair is much lighter. The left sleeve of Gambit's coat is white. This was possibly a graphics problem and was fixed in the final version.[CR]X-Men vs. Street Fighter was released in September 1996 in Japan. It was known there as the 20th video game released for the CPS2 hardware.[CR]Known export releases:[CR]"X-Men vs. Street Fighter [Blue Board]"[CR]"X-Men vs. Street Fighter [Grey Board]"[CR]"X-Men vs. Street Fighter [Orange Board]"[CR]"X-Men vs. Street Fighter [Pink Board]"[CR]9 characters are coming from Marvel comic books, followed by their first appearance : [CR]Apocalypse (aka En Sabah Nur) - X-Factor #5 [CR]Cyclops (aka Scott Summers) - X-Men #1 [CR]Gambit (aka Jean-Luc 'Remy' LeBeau) - Uncanny X-Men #266 [CR]Juggernaut (aka Cain Marko) - X-Men #12 [CR]Magneto (aka Erik 'Magnus' Lehnsherr) - X-Men #1 [CR]Rogue - Avengers Annual #10 [CR]Sabretooth (aka Victor Creed) - Iron Fist #14 [CR]Storm (aka Ororo Munroe) - Giant Size X-Men #1 [CR]Wolverine (aka James 'Logan' Howlett) - Incredible Hulk #180 [CR]9 other characters come from several Street Fighter games : [CR]Akuma ('Gouki' in Japan) - "Super Street Fighter II X - Grand Master Challege" in Japan; "Super Street Fighter II Turbo" in all other regions. [CR]Cammy - "Super Street Fighter II - The New Challengers" [CR]Charlie ('Nash' in Japan) - "Street Fighter Alpha - Warriors' Dreams" in the United States, Canada, and Europe; "Street Fighter Zero" in Japan, Southeast Asia, Brazil, and Hispanic regions [CR]Chun-Li - "Street Fighter II - The World Warrior" [CR]Dhalsim - "Street Fighter II - The World Warrior" [CR]Ken Masters - "Street Fighter" [CR]Major Bison ('Vega' in Japan) - "Street Fighter II - The World Warrior" [CR]Ryu - "Street Fighter" [CR]Zangief - "Street Fighter II - The World Warrior" [CR]In the game, teams are preselected and the player never encounter random teams. Here are the different teams the player will fight against : [CR]* Cyclops and Ryu [CR]* Zangief and Juggernaut [CR]* Storm and Charlie [CR]* Dhalsim and Sabretooth [CR]* Rogue and Chun-Li [CR]* Bison and Magneto [CR]* Gambit and Ken [CR]* Wolverine and Cammy [CR]Akuma is outside the teams as he is an hidden character (see 'Tips and Tricks' section). After defeating six of these teams, the player's team fights Apocalypse himself! In the end, the character who defeated Apocalypse remains under player control and the other one is the ultimate opponent for the one-on-one final battle. [CR]Blanka (of "Street Fighter II - The World Warrior" fame) can be seen hanging out within the background in the 'Death Valley' stage. [CR]Clarence E. Leung holds the official record for this game, on level 5-expert setting, with 2098100 points on March 16, 1999. [CR]Soundtrack releases : [CR]X-Men vs. Street Fighter [Victor Entertainment - VICL-2176 - November 21, 1996][CR][B]Updates[/B][CR]Capcom released 3 different revisions of this game in the arcades, and they all have differences: [CR]Version 1 : [CR]* Ryu and Akuma can recover from their hop kick in mid-air. [CR]* Ryu's "Hurricane Super" can push the opposing player down, allowing the player to recover. [CR]Version 2 : [CR]* Ryu and Akuma can not recover from their hop kick [CR]* Sabretooth's jumping Infinite is a little more difficult to time. [CR]* Dhalsim is no longer able to do a "Yoga Drill" the instant he leaves the floor. He actually has to jump a small distance before the Drill will come out. [CR]* Ryu's "Hurricane Super" pushes the opposing player up rather than down. [CR]Version 3 : [CR]* In this version, Capcom removed all of the Infinites they knew of. And some combos have also been removed. [CR]Green Board releases : [CR]REVISION 1:[CR]* Build date: 960909[CR]* Version 1[CR]REVISION 2:[CR]* Build date: 960910[CR]* Version 1[CR]REVISION 3:[CR]* Build date: 961004[CR]* Version 2[CR]REVISION 4:[CR]* Build date: 961023[CR]* Version 3[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]* Play as Akuma : At the character select screen, highlight Magneto or Juggernaut or Dhalsim or Bison and press Up.[CR]* Play as Alpha Chun Li : At the character select screen, highlight Chun Li, hold the Start button and press any action button.[CR]* Play as the Same Character : Enter the random selection code and if you can make it stop on the highlighted character, the highlight will remain there, enabling you to select the same character twice. This does some strange things to the life bars, so be careful. It may also screw up the palette for one of the characters on the selection grid, but this will not effect game play.[CR]* Alternate Costume Colors : Highlight a character at the character selection screen then press a Punch button for a darker costume or Kick for a lighter costume.[CR]* Random Fighter : At the character select screen, press and hold left or right for 3 seconds. Note : You can also fight against the same character by getting the random selection to stop on the originally highlighted fighter.[CR]* Continue Attacking : Press Start immediately after winning the match to continue hitting the defeated character.[CR]* Rogue's Additional Winning Pose : After you beat an opponent with Rogue, hold all three punches or kicks before she does her normal win pose (If done correctly, Rogue will turn around and say 'TA-DA!').[CR]* In-game tip messages (These are all the tip messages that randomly appear when the player loses) :[CR]1) HP+HK simultaneously for the Cross-over Attack! You can switch your character at any time![CR]2) Push LP+MP+HP while guarding for the Advancing Guard. Push the opponent back![CR]3) When Air Combo starts to move hits the opponent, put the lever Up to chase him and execute a combo![CR]4) Create a quick combo when fighting in the air! Switch your character when vitality is low![CR]5) Back, Back/Down, Down, P before landing for the safe fall! Outsmart your opponent![CR]6) By charging the gauge past level one, you can do a Hyper Combo! Make a comeback![CR]7) Enter Down, Up or LK+MK+HK for a Super Jump! You can attack indefinitely while doing a Super Jump![CR]8) Back, Back/Down, Down, HP+HK while guarding for the Counter! Your partner will assist you.[CR]9) When Level 2 or higher, enter Down, Forward/Down, Forward, HP+HK for the cross-over Combination move![CR]10) Vitality recovers slowly while you're resting. When grabbed, enter Forward MP(HP) immediately![CR]11) You'll escape from the throw move! Forward, Forward or LP+MP+HP for the forward dash![CR]12) Get into the striking distance at once! Marvel Super Heroes vs. Street Fighter [Green Board] (1997)[CR]3. Marvel vs. Capcom - Clash of Super Heroes [Green Board] (1998)[CR]4. Marvel vs. Capcom 2 - New Age of Heroes (2000)[CR]5. game.name: X-Men Vs. Street Fighter (Japan 961004)
game.plot: X-Men vs. Street Fighter (c) 1996 Capcom Company, Limited.[CR]The first 'Capcom vs.' fighter, featuring 16 classic characters and fast-paced tag action. The mighty Apocalypse is reduced to but a punching bag![CR][B]Technical[/B][CR]Runs on the "CP System II" hardware.[CR]Green Board [Japan][CR]Players: Up to 2.[CR]Control: 8-way joystick per player.[CR]Buttons: 6 per player.[CR]= > [1] LP, [2] MP, [3] HP[CR]= > [4] LK, [5] MK, [6] HK[CR][B]Trivia[/B][CR]In August 1996, a prototype of the game was being tested at several arcades across the countries. One difference in this prototype is that Gambit has a different coat color, and his hair is much lighter. The left sleeve of Gambit's coat is white. This was possibly a graphics problem and was fixed in the final version.[CR]X-Men vs. Street Fighter was released in September 1996 in Japan. It was known there as the 20th video game released for the CPS2 hardware.[CR]Known export releases:[CR]"X-Men vs. Street Fighter [Blue Board]"[CR]"X-Men vs. Street Fighter [Grey Board]"[CR]"X-Men vs. Street Fighter [Orange Board]"[CR]"X-Men vs. Street Fighter [Pink Board]"[CR]9 characters are coming from Marvel comic books, followed by their first appearance : [CR]Apocalypse (aka En Sabah Nur) - X-Factor #5 [CR]Cyclops (aka Scott Summers) - X-Men #1 [CR]Gambit (aka Jean-Luc 'Remy' LeBeau) - Uncanny X-Men #266 [CR]Juggernaut (aka Cain Marko) - X-Men #12 [CR]Magneto (aka Erik 'Magnus' Lehnsherr) - X-Men #1 [CR]Rogue - Avengers Annual #10 [CR]Sabretooth (aka Victor Creed) - Iron Fist #14 [CR]Storm (aka Ororo Munroe) - Giant Size X-Men #1 [CR]Wolverine (aka James 'Logan' Howlett) - Incredible Hulk #180 [CR]9 other characters come from several Street Fighter games : [CR]Akuma ('Gouki' in Japan) - "Super Street Fighter II X - Grand Master Challege" in Japan; "Super Street Fighter II Turbo" in all other regions. [CR]Cammy - "Super Street Fighter II - The New Challengers" [CR]Charlie ('Nash' in Japan) - "Street Fighter Alpha - Warriors' Dreams" in the United States, Canada, and Europe; "Street Fighter Zero" in Japan, Southeast Asia, Brazil, and Hispanic regions [CR]Chun-Li - "Street Fighter II - The World Warrior" [CR]Dhalsim - "Street Fighter II - The World Warrior" [CR]Ken Masters - "Street Fighter" [CR]Major Bison ('Vega' in Japan) - "Street Fighter II - The World Warrior" [CR]Ryu - "Street Fighter" [CR]Zangief - "Street Fighter II - The World Warrior" [CR]In the game, teams are preselected and the player never encounter random teams. Here are the different teams the player will fight against : [CR]* Cyclops and Ryu [CR]* Zangief and Juggernaut [CR]* Storm and Charlie [CR]* Dhalsim and Sabretooth [CR]* Rogue and Chun-Li [CR]* Bison and Magneto [CR]* Gambit and Ken [CR]* Wolverine and Cammy [CR]Akuma is outside the teams as he is an hidden character (see 'Tips and Tricks' section). After defeating six of these teams, the player's team fights Apocalypse himself! In the end, the character who defeated Apocalypse remains under player control and the other one is the ultimate opponent for the one-on-one final battle. [CR]Blanka (of "Street Fighter II - The World Warrior" fame) can be seen hanging out within the background in the 'Death Valley' stage. [CR]Clarence E. Leung holds the official record for this game, on level 5-expert setting, with 2098100 points on March 16, 1999. [CR]Soundtrack releases : [CR]X-Men vs. Street Fighter [Victor Entertainment - VICL-2176 - November 21, 1996][CR][B]Updates[/B][CR]Capcom released 3 different revisions of this game in the arcades, and they all have differences: [CR]Version 1 : [CR]* Ryu and Akuma can recover from their hop kick in mid-air. [CR]* Ryu's "Hurricane Super" can push the opposing player down, allowing the player to recover. [CR]Version 2 : [CR]* Ryu and Akuma can not recover from their hop kick [CR]* Sabretooth's jumping Infinite is a little more difficult to time. [CR]* Dhalsim is no longer able to do a "Yoga Drill" the instant he leaves the floor. He actually has to jump a small distance before the Drill will come out. [CR]* Ryu's "Hurricane Super" pushes the opposing player up rather than down. [CR]Version 3 : [CR]* In this version, Capcom removed all of the Infinites they knew of. And some combos have also been removed. [CR]Green Board releases : [CR]REVISION 1:[CR]* Build date: 960909[CR]* Version 1[CR]REVISION 2:[CR]* Build date: 960910[CR]* Version 1[CR]REVISION 3:[CR]* Build date: 961004[CR]* Version 2[CR]REVISION 4:[CR]* Build date: 961023[CR]* Version 3[CR][B]Tips and Tricks[/B][CR]* Play as Akuma : At the character select screen, highlight Magneto or Juggernaut or Dhalsim or Bison and press Up.[CR]* Play as Alpha Chun Li : At the character select screen, highlight Chun Li, hold the Start button and press any action button.[CR]* Play as the Same Character : Enter the random selection code and if you can make it stop on the highlighted character, the highlight will remain there, enabling you to select the same character twice. This does some strange things to the life bars, so be careful. It may also screw up the palette for one of the characters on the selection grid, but this will not effect game play.[CR]* Alternate Costume Colors : Highlight a character at the character selection screen then press a Punch button for a darker costume or Kick for a lighter costume.[CR]* Random Fighter : At the character select screen, press and hold left or right for 3 seconds. Note : You can also fight against the same character by getting the random selection to stop on the originally highlighted fighter.[CR]* Continue Attacking : Press Start immediately after winning the match to continue hitting the defeated character.[CR]* Rogue's Additional Winning Pose : After you beat an opponent with Rogue, hold all three punches or kicks before she does her normal win pose (If done correctly, Rogue will turn around and say 'TA-DA!').[CR]* In-game tip messages (These are all the tip messages that randomly appear when the player loses) :[CR]1) HP+HK simultaneously for the Cross-over Attack! You can switch your character at any time![CR]2) Push LP+MP+HP while guarding for the Advancing Guard. Push the opponent back![CR]3) When Air Combo starts to move hits the opponent, put the lever Up to chase him and execute a combo![CR]4) Create a quick combo when fighting in the air! Switch your character when vitality is low![CR]5) Back, Back/Down, Down, P before landing for the safe fall! Outsmart your opponent![CR]6) By charging the gauge past level one, you can do a Hyper Combo! Make a comeback![CR]7) Enter Down, Up or LK+MK+HK for a Super Jump! You can attack indefinitely while doing a Super Jump![CR]8) Back, Back/Down, Down, HP+HK while guarding for the Counter! Your partner will assist you.[CR]9) When Level 2 or higher, enter Down, Forward/Down, Forward, HP+HK for the cross-over Combination move![CR]10) Vitality recovers slowly while you're resting. When grabbed, enter Forward MP(HP) immediately![CR]11) You'll escape from the throw move! Forward, Forward or LP+MP+HP for the forward dash![CR]12) Get into the striking distance at once!
